Sedih, Transfer ke Bank dari OVO Bakal Kena Biaya
02 Nov 2019, 08:20 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Foto: Ardan Adhi Chandra

Jakarta - Untuk para pengguna OVO siap-siap pada 12 Desember mendatang transfer ke bank akan dikenakan biaya. Dari pengumuman di aplikasi yang diterima detikcom disebutkan, mulai 12 Desember 2019 biaya transfer ke semua bank bakal dikenakan tarif Rp 2.500 setiap transaksi. Kemudian juga diumumkan syarat dan ketentuan terkait biaya tersebut. Yakni hanya OVO Cash yang dapat ditransfer ke bank. Sebelumnya pengiriman uang ke bank melalui OVO gratis alias tanpa biaya.


Foto: Screenshoot Aplikasi OVO

OVO merupakan layanan dompet digital yang dikelola oleh PT Visionet Internasional. Awalnya OVO merupakan aplikasi loyalitas yang mengelola point hasil belanja di pusat perbelanjaan milik Lippo Group.Pada 2017, OVO mendapatkan lisensi dari Bank Indonesia untuk menghadirkan layanan dompet digital. Agar meluaskan pangsa pasarnya, OVO menggandeng Tokopedia dan Grab.Dalam perjalanannya, OVO menjadi salah satu fintech besar di Indonesia. Sepanjang tahun 2018 saja, OVO mengklaim sudah menjalankan 1 miliar kali transaksi.Dengan masuknya OVO ke dalam daftar, kini Indonesia punya lima startup yang telah berstatus unicorn. Satu di antaranya bahkan telah berstatus decacorn.Simak Video "Mulai Desember, Transfer OVO ke Bank akan Dikenakan Biaya!"[Gambas:Video 20detik](kil/eds)

Sad, Transfer to Bank from OVO will be subject to fees
02 Nov 2019, 08:20 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo: Ardan Adhi Chandra

Jakarta - For OVO users getting ready on the 12th of December transfer to the bank will be charged. From the announcement on the application received by AFP mentioned, starting December 12, 2019 transfer fees to all banks will be charged a rate of Rp 2,500 per transaction. Then also announced terms and conditions related to these fees. Ie, only OVO Cash can be transferred to banks. Previously, sending money to a bank via OVO was free.


Photo: OVO Application Screenshot

OVO is a digital wallet service managed by PT Visionet International. Initially OVO was a loyalty application that manages shopping results points at Lippo Group's shopping center. In 2017, OVO obtained a license from Bank Indonesia to provide digital wallet services. In order to expand its market share, OVO took Tokopedia and Grab. In its journey, OVO became one of the major finteches in Indonesia. During 2018, OVO claimed to have run 1 billion transactions. With OVO being included in the list, Indonesia now has five startups that have unicorn status. One of them even has decacorn status.
